intro: Emmenanthe glaberrima, commonly known as the smooth emmenanthe, is a rare and endangered flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, compound leaves and small white flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often in cloud forests, where it forms dense colonies. Its unique botanical features make it an important subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
